definitions.definition: a plane figure with four equal straight sides and four right angles.
a thing having the shape of four equal straight sides and four right angles.
examples: she tore a bit of cloth into a four-inch square

definitions.definition: a thing having the shape or approximate shape of a cube.
an open (typically four-sided) area surrounded by buildings in a town, village, or city.
an open area at the meeting of streets.
a small square area on the board used in a game.
a block of buildings bounded by four streets.
a body of infantry drawn up in rectangular form.
a unit of 100 square ft. used as a measure of flooring, roofing, etc.
the product of a number multiplied by itself.
examples: a circle's area is proportional to the square of its radius

definitions.definition: an L-shaped or T-shaped instrument used for obtaining or testing right angles.
an aspect of 90° (one quarter of a circle).
a person considered to be old-fashioned or boringly conventional in attitude or behavior.
examples: (old) fogey, conservative, traditionalist, conformist, bourgeois, fossil; Moreinformalstick-in-the-mud, fuddy-duddy, prig, stuffed shirt "you're such a square!"Morestick-in-the-mud, fuddy-duddy, prig, stuffed shirt you're such a square!

definitions.definition: a square meal.
make square or rectangular; give a square or rectangular cross section to.
examples: you can square off the other edge

definitions.definition: mark out in squares.
multiply (a number) by itself.
convert (a linear unit of measurement) to a unit of area equal to a square whose side is of the unit specified.
examples: there were only three people per kilometer squared

definitions.definition: make compatible; reconcile.
examples: I'm able to square my profession with my religious beliefs

definitions.definition: be compatible.
examples: do those announcements really square with the facts?
synonyms: be compatible "the theory does not square with the data"

definitions.definition: balance (an account).
examples: they're anxious to square their books before the audit

definitions.definition: make the score of (a match or game) even.
synonyms: make equal "his goal squared the match 1–1"

definitions.definition: secure the help, acquiescence, or silence of (someone), especially by offering an inducement.
bring (one's shoulders) into a position in which they appear square and broad, typically to prepare oneself for a difficult task or event.
examples: chin up, shoulders squared, she stepped into the room

definitions.definition: adopt a posture of defense.
set (a yard or other part of a ship) approximately at right angles to the keel or other point of reference.
(of a planet) have a square aspect with (another planet or position).
examples: Saturn squares the Sun on the 17th
